review:
Okay so why this phone if there are many best alternatives in the market?  
-This one is for those who want a change in design as other phones in this price range looks like clone of each other.  
Now comes to pros and cons :  
Pros  
-desing is fabulous.  
-4gb ram with 64 gigs of internal storage .So you wont need any micro SD card .  
-huawei's own power efficient Kirin 655 octa core processor which is built on 16nm technology .  
-camera is great at outdoor condition.  
-Battery is good as I said it's having a power efficient processor . Will last for one day easily.  
-Sensers: has major sensors accelerometer , proximity , gyroscope,etc and even pedometer which calculates you steps kilometres you have Walken.  
Cons  
-Little slippery as it is glass built.  
-Camera at low light not much great.  
-lacks NFC and IR blaster.  
-some heavy games may hang if pushed to its limit.  
-Little over priced.  
  
***Note*** Many people complaining that seconds sim slot doesn't support
3g/4g. But it does ! You have to go to settings>dual sim settings and select
the sim from which you want to use 3g/4g . That's it! ( But yea both sim cards
cannot be used as 4g at a same time. Even high end phones like Galaxy S8 can't
do that :D )  
(Screenshot attached)  
  
That's it folks! Hope it helped.

Good performance, great screen, good UI even better with Nougat launcher,
great features, speaker is loud enough unlike other reviewers have said,
camera performance worth the price. Front cam is also good but not a selfie
craze person. Nothing else better than this at this price point. If not this
then Honor 6x is next best choice or even better given its low price and solid
built. Have compared to Redmi note 4 which has a better screen, but this one
is asthetically pleasing. Finger print unlocking is surprisingly fast and you
could lock other apps with it. Check out my sample pics. Some taken in pro
mode. My first Honor phone. Hope to use it for next 3 years just like my Moto
G 1st gen.

Review after using phone for a week  
Value for money...  
Really cool looks for this prize...  
You can buy phone with similar spec for little cheaper like 2-3k but for the
design extra money is worth spending...  
Charging time is high but good battery back up...

Super sexy phone! That's what my friends commented upon seeing my Honor 8
Lite. Yes, of course, the phone is sexy and premium. But is it worth the
money? Me, Dijo Jackson writing after two months of Honor 8 Lite usage.  
  
What takes this phone to the limelight? Obviously, it's glass finishing.
Earlier I had Honor 6x, but upon the launch of Honor 8 Lite, I raced to
acquire one. I was really impressed by the way phone looks.  
  
First of all, the phone gives us the premium feel. But upon on close
inspection, I went little upset. The volume rockers + power button are too
flimsy! In fact, this wasn't in my expectation. However, I was still content
the way phone rules.  
  
As of my character, I hate to use back covers or the tempered glass. So within
a matter of time, scratches are evident on the back glass panel nevertheless
on screen too.  
  
Now getting into the performance of this phone, I really liked the new UI.
Quite cool and different approach from Honor. But it doesn't mean that phone
is super fast. Though I'm not much into gaming, switching between apps is a
bit lagging, right from the start. Recently I got an update which made the
situation even worse. After the update, RAM consumption went very high.  
  
Camera quality is much much better compared to Honor 6x (though it has the
dual lens). Low light camera performance is 'okay'.  
  
Another draw back I experienced is on the battery front. Seriously
disappointed with its battery backup. Phone drains out very fast. For an
average user like me, it lasts mostly for a day (don't know how the serious
gamers will handle this).  
  
My Thinking!  
  
Honor 8 Lite is for those, who cares more about looks; who really wants to
stand out in the crowd. Serious gaming or hardcore use? I would suggest better
go for some others.

Hi this is my review regarding Honor 8 lite and its been a while since ive
started using it and ill discuss in depth about it  
  
Note:  
#it wont have quick charging support  
#the phone has glass back and Highly fingerprint magnet.....but thanks to the
back cover which was provided within the box  
#i bought ut around 15k but came to know that during sales even honor 8 comes
at a cost of 18k or less......which is a great thing....if you have that
budget  
  
Physical overview:  
#initial impression are good with the mobile comes with total glass back  
#contents include handset, charger with amp 5V-1A, earphone and some paper
work  
#mobile has 5.2 inch display with full hd and have to say it looks good too..  
#top has 3.5 mm Audio jack bottom with some speakers and a micro usb for
charging and right side has volume trackers and power on off button and left
has sim tray.  
  
In-hand feel:  
#it feels quite good... thanks to the smaller display and one handed usage is
pretty simple  
  
Performance:  
Camera:  
#not very awesome but can be a good option in that price range  
#pictures with good light has ample amount of details and low light
photography can be an issue.  
#zooming is good and some additional features are also good  
  
Battery:  
#since it has no fast charging it will take some time to charge up and battery
life is also good  
  
Processor:  
#actually i dont have any opinion about it since i came to know that kirin
will have some issues but thanks as of now no issues..  
#will update my review if have any issues  
  
Heating:  
#no heating is observed and with extended usage slight heating is observed
which is acceptable  
  
#Overall for the price.... keeping in view the built quality and looks ive
satisfied and i will definitely keep on update my review...  
  
Conclusion:  
#if you are concerned about looks and hate the brand like Xiaomi and Moto then
you may definitely go for it....but it has some good competition with Redmi
note 4, Moto G5 plus and Honor 6X..

review:
Honor 8 Lite Review  
SPECS:  
• 5 inch Full HD screen and pixel density up to 423 PPI  
• Android 7.0, Kirin 655 Octa-Core CPU, 4GB LPDDR3 RAM, and 64GB ROM with
external memory (expandable up to 128GB)  
• 12MP Rear camera and a 8MP front Camera  
• 3000mAh battery  
  
DESIGN:  
• Playing on the same design profile as the Honor 8, the handset's back is
covered with a layer of glass while the front has a 5.2-inch screen with 2.5D
glass. These, when added up with the brushed metal side panels and 7.6mm thin
profile doesn't just make the handset look more elegant but also fragile at
the same time.  
On the back there is a rear camera on the top left corner with LED flash, a
fingerprint sensor at the centre and a company branding below. There are two
speaker grilles at the bottom, of these just one is the main speaker while the
other mirrors the audio coming from the main speaker. A micro USB port lies in
the middle of the speaker.  
The volume and power buttons are on the right side and within a thumbs reach
but unfortunately not as tactile as we've noticed in some other handsets. The
SIM card and microSD card slot lie on the left side bezel, while the front-
facing camera lies on the speaker grille placed above the display. There is
also a multi-colour LED notification light for alerting users.  
  
DISPLAY:  
• The Honor 8 Lite sports a 5.2-inch display with a full-HD resolution, which
makes for a high pixel density. Colour reproduction is neutral but there is an
option to tweak the colour temperature. If you aren't a fan of punchy colours,
you'll like the display. It has good viewing angles but isn't very easy to
read under direct sunlight.  
  
PERFORMANCE:  
• Powering the Honor 8 Lite is Huawei's own Kirin 655 SoC. It is an octa-core
processor with two sets of four ARM Cortex-A53 cores. One set is clocked at
1.7GHz while the other is clocked higher at 2.1GHz. It has an integrated
Mali-T830 GPU, as well as a co-processor called i5 which handles sensor input
when the main cores are in standby, to save power. The Honor 8 Lite also has
4GB of RAM which in our opinion is more than enough to run all kinds of apps.  
• The phone handle most of the apps but, it's not the best processor. It
sometimes lags during heavy games and multitasking.  
  
CAMERA:  
• The Honor 8 Lite comes with a single 12MP rear autofocus camera with f/2.2
aperture and LED flash. The colour are well saturated and the images shot in
both daylight and artificial light conditions are impressive. The images shot
in low light are equally good with much lesser noise levels as compared to
others during low-light shots. There is one-touch access to most of the
frequently-used features such as video capturing, switching between front and
rear cameras, filters, Beauty mode, gallery and the enable/disable flash
option.  
• There is an 8MP front-facing camera with wide-angle lens, which makes taking
selfies easier.  
  
BATTERY:  
• The Honor 8 Lite uses a 3000mAh battery, which in our day-to-day usage ran
for over 9-10 hours constantly on a regular use. Light users will be able to
stretch the running time to over 12 hours easily.  
  
SIDE NOTES:  
• The fingerprint sensor on the back of the Honor 8 Lite is very accurate and
unlocks the phone quickly.  
• It runs Android 7.0 Nougat with Honor's latest EMUI custom skin  
  
VERDICT:  
• While most smartphones in the budget segment now have metal bodies, the
Honor 8 Lite stands out with its glass design. However, those good looks come
at the cost of the phone being slippery and a fingerprint magnet. The Honor 8
Lite also delivers to some extent on the promise it made on the camera front.
Huawei's home-grown Kirin processor performs tasks quite well but stumbles a
little when it comes to heavy tasks such as gaming. So, your choice depends on
what are you really looking for in a smartphone.  
  
Thank You PEACE.  
  
Consider giving a ' Helpful Yes Vote'

I am giving this review after moderate use of around 02 month. This product is
really very good as per specification and performance and its stylish look in
less than 20k after than you go for honor 8 or oneplus, also far much better
than other smart phone.  
  
This phone is 4G Volte i tried jio sim in both slot working fine, it show HD
instead of volte but working without jio4Gvoice app i.e. really good and saves
lot battey.  
Camera performance is owsm, attached few pics in different climate, day,
night, rainy, above clound 😂 etc. Different mode in camera is really nice like
doc scanning, professional... It worth money for me, slight delay in image
stabilisation is there ie auto focus but it ok as OIS is not there.  
  
Battery back is good and sufficient for whole day with moderate usage ultra
power saving mode is really worth, u can use selected app with 2 days batter
backup.  
  
Look is very premium and stylish after iphone and oneplus 3/3t, gives feels of
premium phone, biometric have fine response and doesn't found any lag during
working with it, with normal apps. Display is much attractive and u can
customise it by downloading different themes.  
  
I didn't found any issue with touch till date. Overall its a good product, u
can go for it.

This will be one of the best reviews your going to find.  
  
Pros.  
1\. Lag free. With 4gb ram and a good processor this has not show any lag with
casual use  
2\. Speakers on this device is just phenomenal. They are very loud and clear.  
3\. The back camera is very good. It takes brilliant macro photos.  
4\. User friendly UI. It is very quick and snappy.  
5\. The fingerprint sensor is good.  
6\. Its very sleek and good looking.  
7\. The display is amazing.  
  
Issues(not cons, just problems i faced)  
1\. My device has small heating issues. You won't really notice it. This is
not affecting anyone else  
  
Cons.  
1\. Its back is made of glass so it slippery to hold. You can easily drop it
if you're not careful  
2.The selfie camera could have been better.  
3\. The battery life is not impressive, especially if you use the Internet.  
4\. The screen has no protection. The back side is made of glass which can
also break.  
  
Conclusion. Go for it if you want performance, back camera performance and
entertainment. But it's difficult to hold and will break if your not careful
enough. Don't buy this if your into selfies.

Phone has started hanging just after 15 days... More testing should have been
done by honor before launching this phone..

On time delivery. good product and affordable prize.

NOTE:  
@ This phone is Available on other Online stores as well, so Check it before
Purchasing.  
@ You can UNINSTALL some of the Bloatware present in the Phone, which is a
Good thing.  
@ There's Plastic Back Case & Low Quality earphones in the box.  
@ Out of 64 GB storage you get approx. 50 GB usable Memory.  
* It also has expandable memory option upto 128 GB with HYBRID SIM SLOT.  
@ It supports OTG.  
@ NO NFC support.  
  
I have used this device for about a week now which my Uncle have purchased
from other online store.  
So Following are the Observations regarding this Phone,  
Pros:  
1) Have HiSilicon Kirin 635 (Octa-core) with Mali-T880 MP4 Graphics Unit.  
# This Processor gives decent performance.  
2) Supports Dual Sim 4G .I Used JIO Sim with it and I got good Performance.  
3) Screen is 5.2 inches Full HD display with 2.5D glass which is Slightly
Curved at the edges.  
4) Has Massive 64 GB internal memory.  
# Has Memory Expansion option upto 128 GB, but with Hybrid Slot.  
5) Camera Quality is very impressive compared to price point.  
# Rear camera has f/2.2 aperture which is good.  
# Also captures the picture really Fast.  
#Secondary Cam is just average.  
6) 4GB RAM is sufficient enough for Heavy Multitasking.  
# NO Lags detected yet.  
7) Battery Life is also Decent (3000 mah) (check the details below cons for
Stats.)  
8) Finger Print sensor is Fast.  
9) Built Quality very good and feels Premium.  
10) Light Weight about 153 g. Fair enough for this size phone.  
11) Phone Handles Heavy games like NOVA 3,Asphalt 8, etc Smoothly even at High
graphics settings.  
12) Has OTG Support.  
13) Has Lots of sensor like accelerometer, gyro,Geo magnetic sensor etc.  
  
Cons:  
1) NO Fast Charging.  
2) NO NFC  
3) Has Hybrid sim slot, which means you can't use both the Sim & Memory Card
together.  
4) Processor feels bit lagging when you do heavy multi-tasking.  
5) Front Camera is not that Impressive.  
6) Both the camera performance is dull in Low Light conditions.  
7) Back is bit Slippery, but its compensated by case.  
8) Ram Consumption by System apps. as usual is High.  
  
Battery Performance Stats:  
# Charging from 0 to 100% takes 2 hrs 15 mins. with stock charger.  
  
Usage Mode ---> Battery Performance(Avg.)  
================================================  
@ Mobile Data(3g/4g) Used Continuously ---> 6-7 Hrs.  
@ Normal Calling Only + Standby ---> 25 Hrs.  
@ Normal Calling + Music Playback( Continuous ) ---> 10 Hrs.  
@ Internet Usage on WiFi Only( No Calling ) ---> 10 Hrs.  
@ Gaming ( Wifi) ---> 8 Hrs.  
@ Gaming ( without WiFi ) ---> 9 Hrs.  
@ Video Playback ---> 11 Hrs.  
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
  
VERDICT:  
At this Price Tag, its NO GO. Lacks NFC, Fast Charging, Front Camera quality
and Average Battery Performance.  
I feel Moto G5 Plus performs way better than this phone.  
Or if you budget is low, then Go for Vivo V5 or Redmi Note 4, its better
product and value for money.  
  
Thank You for reading this Review.
